Name: Statue of Standing Man Holding a Decorated Stick
Description: The statue depicts a man standing in a forward-facing position and holding a stick in his right hand. The artist paid special care to the man's head and depicted him with a shaved head and a slightly projecting beard. His eyes are wide and almond shaped. The nose is long and straight and the ears seem relatively large. Arms are attached to the chest and legs are connected to the stomach of the man. The right arm extends along the side of the body and the open palm rests on the thigh. The left hand raises a long stick that stretches from the waist of the man down to the base. The stick is decorated with intersecting geometric ornaments. The back of the statue bears straight ornaments. The base on which the statue is standing is not decorated.
